item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Shares Important Detail About Older Character Buffs
item.description:
Summary

  • Honkai: Star Rail's upcoming buffs to older characters will reportedly have an important caveat for players who already own the units.
  • A leak suggests that Honkai: Star Rail's new buffs to Blade, Jingliu, Silver Wolf and Kafka will be optional, with players able to retain the characters' original versions.
  • Honkai: Star Rail re-visiting some of its older units could open the door to "forgotten" characters like Seele seeing major improvements.

A Honkai: Star Rail leak is hinting at an important detail about the upcoming buffs to older characters, reportedly allowing players to choose whether to use the buffs. The HoYoverse sci-fi RPG's future buffs to some of its oldest roster members has been a hot topic for many fans, with the developer confirming the first four characters to receive an update. Characters like Jingliu and Blade have already seen details of their buffs leaked, with others like Kafka and Silver Wolf also said to be receiving changes. Now, new leaks are hinting at a major element of the changes.

Honkai: Star Rail 's endgame content has often been dominated by the newest additions to the game's roster overtaking older characters. New roster members like Tribbie, Castorice, and Aglaea among others have all made a major impact on the game following their release, with many claimed to be the strongest units the game has seen. HoYoverse officially confirmed that several older characters will be receiving buffs in Version 3.4, looking to bring Star Rail 's older cast members in line with newer releases. However, players may not be forced to use the new buffs coming to Star Rail .

Honkai: Star Rail Leaks Major Detail About Character Buffs

A recent leak shared by HoYoverse leaker Luna is hinting at a surprising element of Honkai: Star Rail 's buffs to older characters. According to the post, the upcoming buffs to Honkai: Star Rail 's older characters will feature the option for players to continue using the older versions of the characters. The post does not clarify how the optional buffs will function, or whether players will make a one-time choice for their characters or be able to swap between old and new scalings. Honkai: Star Rail 's buffs to its older characters are set to launch on July 2.

Honkai: Star Rail 's optional buffs have major implications for two characters whose buffs have already been leaked. Both Jingliu and Blade are set to see major changes to how their kits will function within Star Rail , with both switched to scale more heavily off HP for their abilities. The change could serve as a detriment to Star Rail players who have already built Jingliu or Blade with a focus on ATK, potentially weakening the player's investment into Light Cones and Relics.

Honkai: Star Rail 's buffs to older characters could act as a catalyst for some of the game's "forgotten" older units to see major improvements. Seele has been a popular request to receive buffs as part of the game's focus on improving older characters, with the Quantum character once seen as Star Rail 's most powerful DPS unit. The RPG's standard banner characters could also potentially see improvements, with Star Rail making major changes to the game's permanent lineup. Honkai: Star Rail fans can hope that their favorite characters will be the next to receive some new buffs.

item.title: Schedule 1 Shares Full Release Timeline and Future Content Plans
item.description:
Summary

  • Schedule 1's full release is still 2-3 years away.
  • Tyler, the game's solo developer, intends to employ more staff in the future.
  • Fans will be able to choose between police raids, cartel wars, or a new drug type for the first major content update.

Schedule 1 developer TVGS has shared new details on the game's future, including a timeline for when the smash hit indie will likely receive a full release. Schedule 1 may still be in its early access period, but the game has already become one of the most successful titles to release on Steam, peaking at over 400,000 concurrent players shortly after its release.

As Schedule 1 continues to be developed by a single person, fans have remained skeptical about what the future of the game could realistically look like with just one developer at the helm. However, in just one month, Tyler, the game's creator, has already released multiple updates for Schedule 1 . While some of these updates addressed gameplay issues and bugs, others have already added new content and features to the title. The most recent patch was released over the Easter weekend, introducing a new feature that allows players to access an employee's inventory by interacting with them.

Schedule 1's Full Release Is Still Years Away

Earlier this week, Tyler hosted his first development live stream on Twitch, giving fans a glimpse into the ongoing development of the hit indie game. During the stream, Tyler revealed a myriad of details, including what Schedule 1 's map expansion will look like. One of the many tidbits of information shared by the developer was that a full release is likely still two or three years away, which means Schedule 1 will remain in early access until then. The developer also noted that he hasn't had much time to work on new content due to constant meetings, but with things now calming down, post-launch content should start to ramp up.

Given the huge success of Schedule 1 , it's no surprise that Tyler has been in and out of meetings. With hundreds of thousands of fans now eager for more content, Tyler has outlined what the game's future holds. During the live stream, the developer stated that he is currently working on a new purchasable location, while also revealing that he would like to add more lore to the game and that Uncle Nelson will play a bigger role in the future, hinting at a potential story expansion.

Unlike other indie games and triple-a titles, Schedule 1 is developed solely by Tyler. However, the dev is now working on employing a community manager, an artist, and a quality assurance tester to aid in the development of Schedule 1 . With so much planned for the game's future, it seemed inevitable that Tyler would face no other option but to bring more developers on board. While it is massively impressive to see one person create such an outstanding game, having more developers means more content should be released at a much faster rate.

While Tyler is currently working on adding a new location to the game, he has also revealed that fans will be able to vote between three options for the first major Schedule 1 content update. It's unclear when the update will be released, but fans will have the option to choose between police raids, cartel wars, or shrooms—a new drug type.

item.title: Turok Gets New Update for April 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • The Turok: Dinosaur Hunter remaster received a new update in late April 2025.
  • The game's latest version introduces over 40 changes, ranging from audio improvements to balancing changes and bug fixes.
  • The PC version of Turok now also boasts improved modding support.

The Turok: Dinosaur Hunter remaster received a new update for April 2025. The latest version of Turok introduces approximately 40 changes, depending on the platform.

The remaster specialists at Nightdive Studios have modernized three Turok games to date. Turok: Dinosaur Hunter was the first to receive a remaster, which launched on PC in 2015 before making its way to the Xbox One and Nintendo Switch in 2018 and 2019, respectively. The Turok: Dinosaur Hunter remaster has also been available on the PlayStation Store since early 2021.

The classic '90s first-person shooter has recently received a new update, which rolled out to all platforms in late April 2025. The changelog attached to the Steam version of the patch numbers 42 items, ranging from quality-of-life improvements and bug fixes to audio enhancements and even some combat tweaks, among other novelties. Overall, the patch appears to be largely focused on authenticity—tweaking the remaster with the goal of getting it even closer in line with the 1997 original.

In terms of specific changes, the latest version of the game allows players to customize the line thickness generated by the game's automapping system, which has also been tweaked in order to start rendering lines as quadrangles. Additionally, the update resolves some syncing issues related to the Vulkan graphics API, and reworks some game logic with the goal of minimizing previously identified instances of stuttering.

The new update brings several changes specific to the PC version, including a smarter Steam Workshop mod selection menu that is no longer cluttered with maps from mods the user hasn’t installed. Additionally, alt-tabbing out of Turok or unfocusing its window by any other means will now pause the game's rendering. Nightdive used this release to further improve the remaster's moddability, introducing bug fixes and new features to its existing modding scripts. The developer also fixed an issue preventing the cheats for tiny enemies with big heads from working correctly for bosses and Turok. On a similar note, both Gallery and Credits cheats are now disabled outside the title screen.

New Turok Update Is Largely Based on Community Feedback

Although the Turok remaster had long stopped receiving regular updates, this late April release actually marks its second patch in 2025. The previous update, introduced at the end of February, transitioned the game to the latest build of Nightdive's Kex Engine, version 4.0. While that upgrade had been in the works for some time, the new patch was not planned far in advance. Instead, it is entirely informed by recent community feedback, Nightdive Studios said.

Turok Remaster April 2025 Update Patch Notes

  • New option added to adjust automap line thickness. Automap lines are now rendered as quads, allowing the line thickness option to affect direct x and xbox platforms
  • Use correct output channels for xaudio2. Fixes reverb sounds using 2 channels
  • Entering or exiting a level will now set a checkpoint for the player and checkpoints will not show text or play a sound in boss maps, matching the original behavior.
  • Fix Vulkan syncing issues
  • Improvements to game logic ticker to mitigate stuttering
  • Rendering is disabled when the window is unfocused
  • When a map fails to load it will now fall back to the title screen
  • Fixed several Interpolation issues
  • All particle and wave files are now precached
  • Fixes to the sun's lens flare for it to be blocked by all objects.
  • Turok will no longer make underwater hurt sounds when taking damage in an antigravity area.
  • The current FOV value in the options menu will now be auto selected and an FOV of 100 was added as an additional option.
  • Fixed several issues with dying during the start of the Mantis and T-Rex fights.
  • Fixed Reset Bindings from resetting other menu options.
  • (Steam) Fixed the steam workshop map selection menu. It should now show all maps in user loaded mods only.
  • The Gallery and Credits cheats are now disabled when you’re not on the title screen.
  • Fixed cheats not being unlocked properly
  • Localized text for weapon binds and cheat messages
  • Fixed issues with particles not being setup correctly when spawned
  • Particle decals will now be correctly oriented on top of the water.
  • Increased damage of the Alien Weapon from 15 to 25 and explosive damage from 0-20 to 25(no falloff) with a radius of 20.
  • The Quad Rocket Launcher now does radius damage when impacting default surfaces such as most floors in the game. And 1 of the 4 rockets had a larger radius than it should have.
  • The damage the player does to enemies is now more accurate to the original on hard and hardcore difficulties.
  • Credits will no longer fade out from button presses at the start of the credits. You can also speed up the credits by holding down: right click, space bar or the left face button on your controller.
  • Thunder can now be damaged during his roaring animation matching the original game. When respawning he will run after you immediately.
  • Bosses no longer receive knockback force.
  • Restored Campaigners shield behavior. The shield's total health is 1500 and absorbs damage from explosive and energy based weapons. Other weapons still deal direct damage to the campaigner. The shield will change colors when damaged and will disappear when destroyed. All weapons will then hurt the Campaigner.
  • Footstep sounds will now fade out when obstructed from the player correctly. Sounds with the fadeIfObstructed flag were improved to work with any number of actors and will do less raycasting checks. This flag was also set for the raptor and purlin footsteps.
  • Turok’s landing sound is no longer played when landing on a warp sector.
  • The Fly mode cheat code in the cheat menu will now allow you to go through level geometry.
  • Giblets can no longer spam sounds on every frame
  • Player viewHeight corrected from 51.2 to 55.296
  • Fixed big head scales on raptor, alien, and T-Rex. Leaper now has headtracking and big head mode now works on him.
  • Tiny enemies and big head cheats now work in the Gallery for the Bosses and Turok.
  • Dropped and spawned pickups will now cast a simple shadow.
  • Fixes to sounds with a very low pitch.
  • The player will now rotate when on spinning platforms.
  • Turrets don't lower when frozen by shockwave weapon
  • Check for non solid actors in KnockbackTarget and KnifeAttack functions (swinging sacks hitting pickups)
  • Interpolation when zooming the automap
  • Many fixes and additions for modding scripts

item.title: Genshin Impact Officially Confirms Event Banners for Version 5.6
item.description:
Genshin Impact has revealed the lineup of its Event Banners for Version 5.6, as Escoffier, Navia, Kinich, and Raiden will all feature in the upcoming patch. One notable change in Natlan compared to Fontaine and Sumeru has been the way developers approach banner schedules. Preferential treatment is given to popular Genshin Impact characters, leaving niche 5-Stars like Shenhe, Kokomi, and Eula behind. While players were initially concerned by this change of direction, the use of Chronicled Banners has allowed HoYoverse to feature less popular characters without disrupting its schedule for the Event Banners.

As such, Version 5.6 marks the debut of an Inazuma Chronicled Banner to Genshin Impact , allowing players to pull for characters such as Itto, Ayaka, and even Chiori. On the other hand, the Event Banners continue to be stacked with modern favorites – in this case Navia and Kinich. The former has established herself as the most popular Geo hypercarry, while the latter brings a unique playstyle to the table.

Ahead of Version 5.6, Genshin Impact has officially confirmed the Event Banners for the upcoming patch, revealing that Escoffier and Navia will headline the first half of the update, while the second half will feature Kinich and Raiden. It should be noted that HoYoverse has only confirmed Ifa in Genshin Impact as the featured 4-Star character in Version 5.6, but previous datamining implies that Lynette, Layla, Sara, and Thoma will accompany him as well. Apart from Ifa being in the first half, their distribution across the overall lineup is unknown.

Genshin Impact: Event Banners for Version 5.6

First Half

Escoffier – 5-Star Cryo Polearm

Navia – 5-Star Geo Claymore

Ifa – 4-Star Anemo Catalyst

Second Half

Kinich – 5-Star Dendro Claymore

Raiden – 5-Star Electro Polearm

Unknown

Lynette – 4-Star Anemo Sword

Layla – 4-Star Cryo Sword

Sara – 4-Star Electro Bow

Thoma – 4-Star Pyro Polearm

Despite not being confirmed by HoYoverse, it makes sense for Thoma and Sara to appear in the second half, as both characters have notable synergy with the accompanying 5-Stars. This potentially leaves Lynette and Layla for the first half of Version 5.6, but players should nonetheless wait for official news. One thing to keep in mind is that Escoffier in Genshin Impact is expected to draw plenty of interest, as her ability kit allows Freeze teams to catch up with the current meta.

As a character, Escoffier is meant to pave the way for future 5-Stars like Skirk, who is set to release in Version 5.7 alongside Dahlia. From an investment standpoint, she is definitely the biggest draw from the Event Banners in Version 5.6, but only if players are willing to build a Freeze team in Genshin Impact . Version 5.6 is expected to come out on May 7, 2025.

item.title: These Are the Epic Games Store Free Games Right Now
item.description:
Summary

  • Epic Games Store offers free PC and mobile games weekly.
  • Current freebies include CHUCHEL on PC and mobile, Loop Hero on mobile, and Albion Online Free Welcome Gift on PC until May 1.
  • PC users can expect Super Space Club as the next free game.

There are currently three freebies up for grabs for Epic Games Store users. The Epic Games Store is primarily known as Epic Games' digital storefront for PC, but it's also readily available on mobile devices. Epic Games Store has seriously ramped up its mobile efforts in recent months, employing a strategy that it first used on PC.

For years now, Epic Games Store users have been treated to free PC games. This way, the Epic Games Store is able to convince PC gamers to check it out, with the idea that they will hopefully wind up purchasing games from the storefront as well. Free games are now being given away to mobile players as well with the same goal.

Every week, Epic Games Store users have new free PC and mobile games to claim. Occasionally there is some overlap between the Epic Games Store free games, and that's the case for the latest offerings. From now until May 1, Epic Games Store users can claim CHUCHEL for free on both mobile and PC. PC gamers also have the Albion Online Free Welcome Gift to snag, while those on mobile can get Loop Hero .

Current Epic Games Store Free Games

  • CHUCHEL (April 24 – May 1) - PC & Mobile
  • Loop Hero (April 24 - May 1) - Mobile
  • Albion Online Free Welcome Gift (April 24 – May 1) - PC
    • Knight Adventurer vanity bundle
    • Mistbison mount skin
    • 3 days Premium
    • 250 Learning Points
    • 350 Community Tokens
    • 10 Adept's Focus Restoration Potions
    • 10 Adept's Tomes of Insight (worth a total of 100,000 Fame)

  • Super Space Club (May 1 – May 8) - PC

For those unfamiliar with the games, CHUCHEL is a quirky point-and-click adventure game that also dips its toes in a variety of other genres, while Loop Hero is a critically acclaimed roguelike that originally released in 2021. Albion Online , meanwhile, is a fantasy MMORPG that has proven fairly popular among fans of the genre.

Some PC gamers may be feeling left out when it comes to the free mobile games, but those that have consistently claimed the EGS free game every week should already have Loop Hero in their library. In fact, Loop Hero has been free on the Epic Games Store for PC on more than one occasion, with the latest time being 2023.

In any case, Epic Games Store users on PC can look forward to next week's free game, Super Space Club , which will be up for grabs from May 1 to May 8. Epic Games Store mobile free games are not announced in advance, so fans will have to stay tuned for more information on that front.
